questions.question: Our communities are climate resilient when we:

choices.answer: Learn about potential climate hazards in our communities
Talk and share with your friends & neighbors about risks
All answer choices are accurate
Prioritize & plan responses to extreme climate events

questions.question: Climate mitigation is taking action to reduce our contributions to climate change, such as:

choices.answer: Driving our gasoline fueled cars more
Pretending that human-caused climate change isn't happening
Supporting development of renewable energy like wind & solar
Using air conditioning with doors & windows open

questions.resources:
Photo courtesy of Wikimedia Commons
Author: Kenueone

imageMetadata.resources:
Photo courtesy of Wikimedia Commons

questions.question: We can adapt to climate change in the following ways, except:
questions.resources: Photo courtesy of Environmental Protection Agency: http://www.thealternative.in/society/the-agents-of-change-project-gets-youth-to-actively-discuss-climate-change/

choices.answer: Building stronger & safer communities and infrastructure
Ignoring the issue & continuing with business as usual.
Using sound science to manage climate impacts
Protecting the economy while balancing natural resource use

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of Environmental Protection Agency: http://www.thealternative.in/society/the-agents-of-change-project-gets-youth-to-actively-discuss-climate-change/

choices.answer: Building more houses on flood plains
Making sure that our levees are failing
Restoring habitats like marshes, sandbars & creek beds
Pretending that sea level isn't rising

questions.question: We can make our communities stronger & safer against climate change by:

questions.resources: Photo courtesy of the NCA 2014: https://nca2014.globalchange.gov/

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of the NCA 2014: https://nca2014.globalchange.gov/

questions.question: All of the following are examples of using sound science to manage climate impacts except:

choices.answer: Making decisions based upon real data & observations
Basing our actions on personal belief systems
Making data available to end-users, in easy to use formats
Using peer-reviewed science as a basis for taking action
Wishing for more water during droughts
Training students & workers for renewable energy jobs
Rebuilding houses in floodplains after a superstorm floods
Watching reruns of "Friends"

questions.question: An example of protecting our economy while balancing resource use is:
Meeting the needs of the present without compromising the needs of future generations is:

choices.answer: What Yoda said to Luke
A definition of sustainable development
Something we should not strive for as a society
All answer choices are accurate
True
False

questions.question: Climate change adaptation can fulfill societal goals like sustainable development.
Your carbon footprint can be defined as:

choices.answer: The amount of coal we burn to cool our homes
The total amount of greenhouse gases we individually cause
The total amount of methane we personally emit each year
The number of times we drive somewhere instead of walking

questions.question: Of the following, the most impactful action you can take to reduce your carbon footprint is:

choices.answer: Turn off your lights more often
Drive a hybrid car
Eat a plant-based diet
Hang your clothes to dry
Buying less stuff
Changing incandescent bulbs to LEDs
Driving a car only when absolutely necessary
Taking fewer showers

questions.question: Of the following, the most impactful action you can take to reduce your carbon footprint is:

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: You can make a real difference by talking with your friends & family about climate change.

choices.answer: Host a dinner where only local food is served
Play these Kahoots!
Join a climate action group online or in your community
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: A fun way to engage your friends & family in activities about climate change is:
